humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a tumor size of 35 mm (3.5 cm) for the invasive ductal carcinoma. According to the rules provided, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, T3 tumors are more than 5 cm, and T4 tumors are of any size with direct extension to the chest wall or skin. Since the tumor size is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, the T stage is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor size is given as 35 mm, which is approximately 3.5 cm. According to the TNM staging system for cancer, a tumor size of 3.1 to 4 cm corresponds to a T2 stage. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
